Legislative Malapportionment

COUNT III
Deprivation of the Freedom of Association

evidence.text: In Violation of Article I, § 2 of the U.S. Constitution
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief, Three Judge Panel Requested

add_extracted.value: Article I, § 2 of the U.S. Constitution

evidence.text: In Violation of the Fourteenth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief, Three Judge Panel Requested

add_extracted.value: Fourteenth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution

evidence.text: In Violation of the First and Fourteenth Amendments to the U.S. Constitution
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief, Three Judge Panel Requested

add_extracted.value: First Amendment to the U.S. Constitution

evidence.text: under S.C. Code Ann. § 2‑1‑70 and S.C. Code Ann. § 7‑19‑35
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief, Three Judge Panel Requested

add_extracted.value: S.C. Code Ann. § 2‑1‑70

evidence.text: under S.C. Code Ann. § 2‑1‑70 and S.C. Code Ann. § 7‑19‑35
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief, Three Judge Panel Requested

add_extracted.value: S.C. Code Ann. § 7‑19‑35

evidence.text: i. Declare that the current configurations of South Carolina’s U.S. Congressional districts under S.C. Code Ann. § 2‑1‑70 and S.C. Code Ann. § 7‑19‑35, violate Article I, § 2 of, and the First and Fourteenth Amendments to, the U.S. Constitution;
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief, Three Judge Panel Requested

add_extracted.value: Declaratory relief that the current configurations of South Carolina’s U.S. Congressional districts under S.C. Code Ann. § 2‑1‑70 and S.C. Code Ann. § 7‑19‑35 violate Article I, § 2 and the First and Fourteenth Amendments to the U.S. Constitution

evidence.text: ii. Declare that the current configurations of South Carolina’s state House districts under the 2010 legislative districting plan, S.C. Code Ann. § 2‑1‑70 and S.C. Code Ann. § 7‑19‑35, violate the First and Fourteenth Amendments to the U.S. Constitution;
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief, Three Judge Panel Requested

add_extracted.value: Declaratory relief that the current configurations of South Carolina’s state House districts under the 2010 legislative districting plan, S.C. Code Ann. § 2‑1‑70 and S.C. Code Ann. § 7‑19‑35, violate the First and Fourteenth Amendments to the U.S. Constitution

evidence.text: iii. Permanently enjoin Defendants and all persons acting on their behalf or in concert with them from implementing, enforcing, or conducting any elections under South Carolina’s current U.S. Congressional or state House districts;
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief, Three Judge Panel Requested

add_extracted.value: Permanently enjoin Defendants and all persons acting on their behalf or in concert with them from implementing, enforcing, or conducting any elections under South Carolina’s current U.S. Congressional or state House districts

evidence.text: iv. Establish a schedule that will enable the Court, in the absence of timely enacted and lawful plans for South Carolina’s current U.S. Congressional and state House districts, to adopt and implement new plans for South Carolina’s U.S. Congressional and state House districts;
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief, Three Judge Panel Requested

add_extracted.value: Establish a schedule that will enable the Court, in the absence of timely enacted and lawful plans for South Carolina’s current U.S. Congressional and state House districts, to adopt and implement new plans for South Carolina’s U.S. Congressional and state House districts

evidence.text: v. Issue an order, as needed, staying the deadlines contained in S.C. Code Ann. §§ 7‑11‑15, 7‑13‑45, 7‑11‑210, and 7‑13‑40, as well as any other deadlines that are dependent upon these deadlines, as they pertain to elections for seats in the United States Congress and the South Carolina House of Representatives pending either a. The Court’s determination that the new districts for those elective bodies are constitutional; or b. The Court’s implementation of interim redistricting plans for those elective bodies.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief, Three Judge Panel Requested

add_extracted.value: Issue an order, as needed, staying the deadlines contained in S.C. Code Ann. §§ 7‑11‑15, 7‑13‑45, 7‑11‑210, and 7‑13‑40, as well as any other deadlines that are dependent upon these deadlines, as they pertain to elections for seats in the United States Congress and the South Carolina House of Representatives pending either a) the Court’s determination that the new districts for those elective bodies are constitutional; or b) the Court’s implementation of interim redistricting plans for those elective bodies

evidence.text: vi. Retain jurisdiction while Defendants enact plans by this Court’s deadline;
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief, Three Judge Panel Requested

add_extracted.value: Retain jurisdiction while Defendants enact plans by this Court’s deadline

evidence.text: vii. Award Plaintiffs’ attorneys’ fees and costs in this action;
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief, Three Judge Panel Requested

add_extracted.value: Award Plaintiffs’ attorneys’ fees and costs

evidence.text: viii. Grant such other and further relief as this Court deems just and proper in the circumstances.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief, Three Judge Panel Requested

add_extracted.value: Grant such other and further relief as this Court deems just and proper in the circumstances

event.doc_name: Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: i.  Declare the Challenged Congressional Districts adopted in S. 865 to be unconstitutional as violating the Fourteenth Amendment of the U.S. Constitution as racially gerrymandered districts;
evidence.source_document: Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Declare the Challenged Congressional Districts adopted in S. 865 to be unconstitutional as violating the Fourteenth Amendment of the U.S. Constitution as racially gerrymandered districts

evidence.text: ii.  Declare the Challenged Congressional Districts adopted in S. 865 to be unconstitutional as violating the Fourteenth and Fifteenth Amendments of the U.S. Constitution as passed with discriminatory intent as a motivating factor;
evidence.source_document: Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Declare the Challenged Congressional Districts adopted in S. 865 to be unconstitutional as violating the Fourteenth and Fifteenth Amendments of the U.S. Constitution as passed with discriminatory intent as a motivating factor

evidence.text: iii.  Preliminary and permanently enjoin Defendants and their agents from calling, holding, supervising or certifying any elections under S. 865 until a constitutionally and VRA-complaint remedial plan is adopted for the 2024 elections or any special election in 2023;
evidence.source_document: Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Preliminary and permanently enjoin Defendants and their agents from calling, holding, supervising or certifying any elections under S. 865 until a constitutionally and VRA-complaint remedial plan is adopted for the 2024 elections or any special election in 2023

evidence.text: iv.  Order expedited hearings and briefing, consider evidence, and take any other action necessary for the Court to order a VRA-complaint for new South Carolina Congressional districts;
evidence.source_document: Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Order expedited hearings and briefing, consider evidence, and take any other action necessary for the Court to order a VRA-complaint for new South Carolina Congressional districts

evidence.text: v.  Set an immediate and reasonable deadline for Defendants to adopt and enact a congressional redistricting plan that (1) does not dilute, cancel out, or minimize the voting strength of Black South Carolinian voters or subject them to intentionally discriminatory districts, and (2) does not violate the VRA, federal and state constitutions, and other applicable law;
evidence.source_document: Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Set an immediate and reasonable deadline for Defendants to adopt and enact a congressional redistricting plan that (1) does not dilute, cancel out, or minimize the voting strength of Black South Carolinian voters or subject them to intentionally discriminatory districts, and (2) does not violate the VRA, federal and state constitutions, and other applicable law

evidence.text: vi.  Order new redistricting maps if Defendants fail to adopt maps that conforms with this Court’s judgment;
evidence.source_document: Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Order new redistricting maps if Defendants fail to adopt maps that conforms with this Court’s judgment

evidence.text: vii.  Order changes to any relevant election-related deadlines to allow the adoption of congressional and state legislative maps that conform with this Court’s judgment;
evidence.source_document: Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Order changes to any relevant election-related deadlines to allow the adoption of congressional and state legislative maps that conform with this Court’s judgment

evidence.text: viii.  Retain jurisdiction over this matter until Defendants enact compliant maps by this Court’s deadline;
evidence.source_document: Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Retain jurisdiction over this matter until Defendants enact compliant maps by this Court’s deadline

evidence.text: ix.  Retain jurisdiction over this matter for such a period it deems appropriate and require Defendants to submit future congressional and state legislative redistricting plans for preclearance review from this court or the U.S. Attorney General under Section 3(c) of the VRA, 52 U.S.C. § 10302(c);
evidence.source_document: Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Retain jurisdiction over this matter for such a period it deems appropriate and require Defendants to submit future congressional and state legislative redistricting plans for preclearance review from this court or the U.S. Attorney General under Section 3(c) of the VRA, 52 U.S.C. § 10302(c)

evidence.text: x.  Award Plaintiffs’ attorneys’ fees and costs in this action;
evidence.source_document: Third Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Award Plaintiffs’ attorneys’ fees and costs in this action
